Kind regards,
Marcus
subject: Re: Green Futures Conferences: Invitation to help tutor

email:
Hi everyone,

Thanks for offering to help with the tutorial. I'm super excited to deliver
it and I hope people will enjoy going through the resource that we created.

With regard to how we envisaged the tutorial to be run: we have written the materials such that it can basically be a self-contained document. There are
lots of explanations, and links to external resources. Our intention is to convey the
high level ideas, rather than investing time with the proofs. We
also wanted to draw attention to some, but not all, of the theoretical caveats. With that in mind, I assume most of the
questions will be about clarifications with these concepts (which can be
challenging at first pass).

Should we have the meeting on Monday at the Green Futures Conferences at some
point? It would be nice for us to meet in-person and have an informal chat
rather than rushing to do it online. Let me know your thoughts on this.

Kind regards,
Marcus
subject: Re: Green Futures Conferences: Invitation to help tutor

email:
Hi Raphael,

Thanks for offering to help out.

To ease your mind, we have structured the tutorial such that it is super
beginner friendly. There is very little for the students to derive,
but rather to think about high level questions. If you are able
to convey this, that would be
absolutely perfect.

Kind regards,
Marcus
subject: Re: Green Futures Conferences: Invitation to help tutor
